children.text: Anthony Gagliardi

is a co-founder of Almost Studio. He is currently an Instructor at the Syracuse University School of Architecture where he teaches in the undergraduate design studio curriculum. Prior to Syracuse, Anthony was a Critic at the Yale School of Architecture where he taught a graduate advanced design studio and drawing analysis course with Peter Eisenman. He has worked for firms including Eisenman Architects and Steven Harris Architects on projects ranging from urban master plans to site-specific residences. Anthony received a Master of Architecture from Yale University , where he was the Yansong Ma Scholar, and a Bachelor of Science in Architecture with Distinction from The Ohio State University.
Dorian Booth

is a co-founder of Almost Studio. He is currently a Lecturer at the Yale School of Architecture. He has also been a Visiting Assistant Professor at Pratt Institute in the Graduate Architecture and Urban Design program and an Adjunct Professor at the New Jersey Institute of Technology, where he taught design studio. Dorian has previously worked for FreelandBuck and LOT-EK in New York, as well as Joeb Moore & Partners in Greenwich, CT. He received a Master of Architecture from Yale University, where he was the recipient of the AIA Henry Adams Medal, and a Bachelor of Arts in Architecture from the University of Pennsylvania.
Almost Studio

is a Brooklyn-based design practice established in 2018. Their unique approach considers a successful project as never complete and always becoming: exposing unknown cultural, social, and spatial potential as time passes. In that sense, the process of design and the close-out of construction is simply the starting point of their projects. Focused on process rather than style or typology, Almost Studio challenges commonly held beliefs, conventions, and canons at all project scales. This has led to recognition and publication of many projects including exhibitions, castles, installations, urban design, furniture, fashion runways, residences, storefronts and art festivals. Current and past projects include work with the Museum of Fine Arts Houston, Chloé, Sandy Liang, ArtPrize, Dallas Contemporary, New York Fashion Week, and private residences in New York, California, Maine, and Villecien, France.

coverImage.alt: View from street of Sandy Liang Retail store with clothing in the window designed by Almost Studio

name: Sandy Liang Runway

coverImage.alt: a group of yellow rolls of paper wrapped in plastic bench designed by Almost Studio

children.text: Imagine your grandparent’s house and their couches sealed in an all-encompassing, skillfully-seamed, slippery, crystal-clear slipcover. Now insert yourself into the scene of a New York Fashion Week runway in 2019. One is comfortable and homey, the other is exciting and potentially anxiety-inducing. The Sandy Liang Runway design attempts to bring the comfort and acceptance felt in your grandparent’s house to New York Fashion Week with the installation of a custom designed, oversized, slipcovered couch. The sinuous curves reference the multiple positions and views allowed by ordinary sectional sofas while contextually adapting to the existing building’s columnar structure. Cushions are pink insulation rolls, which are economical “found objects” used in everyday construction in order to elevate their characteristics of color, shape, and flexibility. The slipcover is two continuous rolls of clear vinyl (top and sides) form-fittingly seamed together.
This is another paragraph.

images.alt: Close up of insulation roll with tag on top designed by Almost Studio
